p: In another study regarding antinociceptive effects of S. lavandulifolia extracts, the implication of essential oil (EOSl) and (−)- α-bisabolol (BIS), its main compound, was studied in algogen-induced orofacial nociceptive behavior in mice. Authors have shown that the treatment with EOS1 and BIS has significantly reduced pain in different orofacial pain tests on mice, but BIS proved to be more effective, significantly reducing nociceptive behavior in all tests including both phases of the formalin test [ 142].
